title: Random Musing: A brief history of the Church of England (as it gets its first woman Archbishop of Canterbury)
summary_full: It begins, inevitably, with Henry VIII, who married Catherine but couldn’t produce a male heir. The Pope refused to annul the marriage because Catherine was the aunt of Charles V, the Holy Roman Emperor whose armies effectively controlled Rome — a man at whose snook the Pope could ill afford to cock. So, Henry decided it was time to do a Thanos and take matters into his own hands.
